alert.note: Alert for Brown; Calumet; Door; Kewaunee; Manitowoc; Marathon; Menominee; Northern Oconto County; Outagamie; Portage; Shawano; Southern Marinette County; Southern Oconto County; Waupaca; Waushara; Winnebago; Wood (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 28 at 6:49AM CST by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...SNOW EXPECTED TO CREATE HAZARDOUS TRAVEL CONDITIONS OVER PORTIONS OF EAST-CENTRAL WISCONSIN LATE THIS AFTERNOON AND TONIGHT... A low pressure system passing south of the area will bring a round of light snow to east-central Wisconsin this afternoon and tonight. Snow from the system will begin to slowly spread north into portions of central and east-central Wisconsin during the mid-day hours. The snow will slowly creep north during the afternoon and early evening, continue through midnight, then diminish to flurries late tonight. One to three inches of snow is expected along and south of a line from near Wisconsin Rapids to Appleton to Kewaunee, with less than an inch farther north. Two to four inches of snow is expected in Manitowoc county, with locally higher amounts possible near Lake Michigan. Temperatures will remain well below freezing, so roads are likely to become snow covered and slippery once the snow begins. In addition, gusty northeast winds could result in some blowing and drifting snow overnight, especially near Lake Michigan. Anyone planning to travel across central or east-central Wisconsin during the late afternoon or evening should be prepared for hazardous travel conditions due to snow covered and slippery roads. Be sure to allow extra travel time so you can reach your destination safely.
